Dear Ms. Lessnau:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-6992.

ALLEGATION:
On 6/24/21, youth was outside and acting out. When attempting to go inside, a staff
member blocked youth and pushed youth backward. Youth became more
escalated. When the door was opened, youth kicked staff member and staff
member pushed youth back a second time.
INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed Youth A at Christ Child House on 06/25/2021. Youth A disclosed on
06/24/2021 he was outside playing and wanted to go in the house and was told by
Shift Supervisor he could not go in the house. He said Shift Supervisor closed the
door and would not let him enter, so he got angry and punched the door and the
window. He denied being pushed, but said that he did kick Shift Supervisor, because
he would not let him go inside. Youth A reported that there were two other staff
outside during the incident. He denied getting hurt or having any injuries. Youth A
reported he was angry and frustrated because he could not go inside. Youth A
2

reported that after the incident he walked outside until he calmed down. Youth A
reported he feels safe and expressed no worries or concerns.
I interviewed Chief Administrator at Christ Child House on 06/25/21. She reported
that Shift Supervisor has been suspended for two weeks as a result of the incident
and will not have any contact with Youth A. She reported that Youth A has gotten
very aggressive the past several months. He has broken windows, doors, and is
very aggressive with the staff. She has submitted a 30-day notice to have him
removed.
I reviewed incident report dated 06/24/21 written by Staff 1. The incident report
stated that on 06/24/21 Youth A asked to go back in the building, and Shift
Supervisor told Youth A he could not come in the building at this time. Youth A
punched the window and was attempting to get into the building. Staff 1 tried to
redirect Youth A away from the building. Shift Supervisor came outside and that’s
when Youth A kicked him. Shift Supervisor caught Youth A’s foot, while Staff A was
trying to stop the situation from going any further. Youth A calmed down and was
escorted away from the building.
I interviewed Staff 1 at Christ Child House on 06/29/21. Staff 1 reported on
06/24/2021 he was outside with four youth and Youth A was doing flips on the
swing, so he told Youth A not to do flips because he can get hurt. Youth A got angry
and wanted to go in the building and that’s when Shift Supervisor told him he could
not go inside at that moment and closed the door. Youth A started to punch the door
and the window. Staff 1 reported he tried to redirect Youth A away from the building,
but Youth A refused and that’s when Shift Supervisor opened the door. Youth A
kicked Shift Supervisor and Shift Supervisor caught Youth A’s foot, and that’s when
Staff 1 caught Youth A from falling backwards. Staff 1 reported he and Staff 2
walked Youth A away from the building until he calmed down. Staff 1 reported an
incident reported was completed.
I interviewed Staff 2 at Christ Child House on 06/29/21. Staff 2 reported that on
06/24/2021, he did not witness Shift Supervisor push Youth A. He reported he did
witness Youth A kick Shift Supervisor and Shift Supervisor caught his foot and that’s
when Youth A fell backwards and was caught by Staff 1 from falling. Youth A was
angry and being aggressive.
I reviewed the video footage at Christ Child House on 07/01/2021 from the incident
on 06/24/2021. The video shows at 04:20 pm Shift Supervisor is blocking the door
while Youth A is trying to come inside the building. Shift Supervisor uses his left
hand to push Youth A on his chest away from the door and closes the door. Youth A
punches the door and the window next to the door. Staff 1 is seen redirecting Youth
A away from the building. Shift Supervisor opens the door and Youth A kicks him.
Shift Supervisor catches Youth A’s foot, which resulted in Youth A falling backward
and Staff 1 caught Youth A from falling.
3

I interviewed the Director of Residential Services at Christ Child House on
07/01/2021. She reported Shift Supervisor reaction to the situation was not
appropriate. She reported that she teaches the CPI trainings at Christ Child House
and when a youth is combative (punching or hitting) staff is to block and back away.
A copy of their restraint policy was reviewed.
I interviewed Shift Supervisor via telephone on 07/01/21. Shift Supervisor reported
he has been working at Christ Child House for 12 years. He reported Youth A got
upset because he was told not to do flips on the swings. He reported Youth A was
trying to come inside and he told him cannot come inside at that moment. He
reported they would have been out of ratio. He said that he moved him away and
closed the door. Shift Supervisor reported Youth A started to punch the door and
window, so he opened the door and that’s when Youth A kicked Shift Supervisor in
the stomach. Shift Supervisor responded by grabbing Youth A’s foot. Youth A began
to fall backward and Staff 1 caught him. Shift Supervisor reported he was hurt as a
result of the kick, had to seek medical attention, and had abdominal contusion. He
reported he was suspended for two weeks.
I completed a pre-exit conference of preliminary findings with Director of Residential
Services via telephone on 07/15/2021. There is sufficient evidence in the video that
show’s Shift Supervisor pushing Youth A.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Discipline.
(2) An institution shall prohibit all cruel and severe
discipline, including any of the following:
(a) Any type of corporal punishment inflicted in any
manner.
4

ANALYSIS: The facility is found in non-compliance as Shift Supervisor was
observed in video footage to push Youth A using physical force
as a means of behavior management.
Technical Assistance
Although the TCI model does not address specifically how a
staff member should respond to a youth kicking them, it does
state that staff should remain at least a leg length away from the
youth. Supervisor was observed to grab the youth’s leg. Staff
should be reminded of TCI practice to keep distance between
staff and escalated youth, as well as to step away and block a
kick opposed to grabbing youth’s leg which restricts the youth’s
free movement.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
SIR2021C0217020 dated 3/24/21, CAP approval dated 4/15/21
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend no change in the
license status.
